issue.title: The site can't provide a secure connection: https://localhost:4433
issue.body:
Hello Team,
I have bult the chromium demo un ubuntu server but at the last step i have recived the error "The site can't provide a secure connection". Client ans server dont support the common ssl.
I am able to successfully rin the TLS connection in boringssl

![BoringSSL_passed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28886647/85852131-9f7a6a00-b7cd-11ea-94f6-c074d073caff.jpg)
![Error on local host](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28886647/85852186-b7ea8480-b7cd-11ea-97aa-a303e6a5574b.jpg)

comment.body:
Hello Team,
Any idea on the issue? Also when i ran the command **git apply BUILD.gn.patch** it says _unrecognized input_ though i am able to run the next command succssefully.
![unrecognized input](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28886647/86237496-7be26580-bbb9-11ea-8cf7-597f80313304.png)

issue.title: OSX build warnings
issue.body:
When I just built on OSX for the first time in a long time, these warnings appeared - and they're also in CCI...
```
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(cpu.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(cpu.c.o) has no symbols
```
--> Possibly some `cmake` magic required?

comment.body:
Hi,

1) The file `liboqs/src/kem/bike/CMakeLists.txt` tells cmake to always compile the files `gf2x_mul.c` and `gf2x_portable.c`
2) On [CMakeLists.txt#L21](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/master/src/kem/bike/CMakeLists.txt#L21) the compilation sets the `PORTABLE` flag for `Darwin` systems
3) The gf2x_mul.c is considered empty when `USE_OPENSSL_GF2M` is defined
4) The gf2x_portable.c is considered empty when `USE_OPENSSL_GF2M` is defined or when the `PORTABLE` macro is unset. From (2) we get that `PORTABLE` is set and thus `USE_OPENSSL_GF2M` must also be set. 
5) The `USE_OPENSSL_GF2M` flag is set in the default build of OpenSSL.

- To solve the issue, the compilation should not compile the `gf2x_mul.c` and `gf2x_portable.c` files when OpenSSL is used and the `USE_OPENSSL_GF2M` is enabled in the OpenSSL headers.

issue.title: OSX build warnings
issue.body:
When I just built on OSX for the first time in a long time, these warnings appeared - and they're also in CCI...
```
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols

/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(cpu.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(cpu.c.o) has no symbols
```
--> Possibly some `cmake` magic required?

comment.body:
@drucker-nir Thanks for the assessment and suggestion.

Do I get you right that these 2 files _should_ be compiled not only if OpenSSL is _not_ used but also if OpenSSL is used _and_ `USE_OPENSSL_GF2M`is *not* set (i.e., the OpenSSL define `OPENSSL_NO_EC2M` *is set* as per [this](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/7f7bbaf59e9bc1847c7ffc9efe298409a0b71ea2/src/kem/bike/additional/openssl_utils.h#L15))? That'd be a bit more tricky and I'd suggest waiting with this for the return of our "CMake guru" @xvzcf -- as that would necessitate making an OpenSSL define visible as a CMake variable (to make compilation conditional on that)... 
But then again, having looked through the OpenSSL source code I did not find any location which sets `OPENSSL_NO_EC2M` (which would be a prerequisite for any OpenSSL distribution/include to show it as set, if I'm not mistaken).... 

Based on this, would you agree there's no real problem simply disabling compilation of these two files if OpenSSL is used?

issue.body:
When I just built on OSX for the first time in a long time, these warnings appeared - and they're also in CCI...
```
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols

/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols

/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_portable.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(gf2x_mul.c.o) has no symbols
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ranlib: file: lib/liboqs.a(cpu.c.o) has no symbols
```
--> Possibly some `cmake` magic required?

comment.body:
Yes, you are right.

The reason we added this code in the first place is that BoringSSL sets the `OPENSSL_NO_EC2M` flag. The reason is that it does not support binary curves. Thus, in your suggestion the compilation should check whether they use OpenSSL, BoringSSL, LibreSSL etc.  I am not familiar with other libraries that may be used by LibOQS and if they set this flag or not.
